intro: Euphrasia tatarica var. obtusiserrata, commonly known as the Tatarian eyebright, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia and parts of Eastern Europe. It is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and can be found in meadows, grasslands, and along stream banks. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have rounded, serrated edges, giving it a distinctive appearance. The species is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
